node.title: Queensland's reopening and border bubble rules explained
node.alt: Police speak to people in a row of cars.
node.description: Queensland is bringing forward its much-awaited reopening, dropping border restrictions for all interstate travellers from December 13, four days earlier than predicted â€” and opening up the NSW border zone for residents.
node.content:
["Queensland is bringing forward its much-awaited reopening, dropping border restrictions for all interstate travellers from December 13, four\u00a0days earlier than predicted \u2014 and opening up movement in the NSW border zone for residents.", "People who have been in hotspots in New South Wales, Victoria and South Australia\u00a0will be able to enter the state from 1:00am next Monday.", "The state expects that 80 per cent\u00a0of the population aged 16 and over will be fully vaccinated sometime later this week.", "People will be considered \"fully vaccinated\" one week after their second dose of a COVID-19 vaccine, instead of two weeks afterwards.", "
Freedom of movement in border zone
", "Fully vaccinated border residents will be able to move freely across the border, though they will need a border pass.", "Border passes will be valid for 14 days at a time.", "Residents on the NSW side of the border will be free to move throughout the border zone for any reason if fully immunised \u2014\u00a0but if they go outside the border zone, they'll be subject to the same rules as any traveller from a hotspot.", "For example, a resident in the NSW town of Pottsville who is fully vaccinated and has a valid border pass can drive to Burleigh Heads, but will need proof of a negative COVID-19 test within the last 72 hours to drive to Brisbane.", "Queensland residents \u2013 from anywhere in the state \u2013 will be able to travel into the NSW side of the border zone freely, but if they venture further south\u00a0they will need to comply with the hotspot rules.", "For example, a fully vaccinated Toowoomba couple can take a day trip to Byron Bay and return,\u00a0but if they spent the weekend in Coffs Harbour, they will need negative test results before being permitted back over the border.", "Unvaccinated residents of the border zone will be restricted to travel for essential purposes, just as they are now.", "There will also be separate requirements for restricted areas of the border zone. Currently, Moree Plains Shire is the only restricted zone, but others could be declared if there are concerning outbreaks.", "
Expect road travel to take longer
", "Queensland police have warned people to expect long delays at the border.", "Travellers have been urged to keep their border passes handy and to consider travelling outside of peak times to help manage the traffic.", "
Travellers from domestic hotspots
", "Fully vaccinated people will be able to enter Queensland by road or air\u00a0and will not need to quarantine.", "They will need to have had a negative COVID test result returned within 72 hours of their arrival, then get tested again\u00a0five days after arrival.", "People who aren't fully vaccinated will need to arrive by air and undergo 14 days of hotel quarantine.", "
International travellers
", "People arriving from overseas must be fully vaccinated and have received a negative COVID test result within 72 hours of their arrival.", "They will also need to be tested on arrival, then\u00a0go into quarantine \u2014 either at home or in a hotel \u2014\u00a0for 14 days.", "", "
Queensland pubs and clubs will only be open to people who are doubly vaccinated.(ABC Rural: David Barnott-Clement)
", "
Heading to the pub
", "While Queensland will enact its relaxed border rules ahead of schedule, it's sticking to December 17 for measures for Queenslanders who have not been vaccinated.\u00a0", "From that date, venues such as cafes, restaurants, pubs, nightclubs, live music venues and festivals, stadiums, theatres and cinemas will only be open to patrons and employees who are fully vaccinated.", "There will be no other restrictions like density limits imposed.", "Weddings will have no\u00a0limits on\u00a0guest lists as long as attendees are all fully vaccinated, and only fully vaccinated people will be able to visit hospitals, aged care facilities, prisons and disability services \u2013 except in emergency and end-of-life situations."]
